messages.content: How has the political ideology of the Republican and Democratic parties changed from the 90's - 2021?

The Republican Party has shifted to the right, focusing on tax cuts, fewer regulations, and a conservative approach to foreign policy. The Democratic Party, on the other hand, has shifted to the left, focusing on tax hikes, more regulations, and a more liberal approach to foreign policy. The Republican Party has become more conservative, focused on tax cuts, fewer regulations, and a conservative approach to foreign policy. The Democratic Party has become more liberal, focused on tax hikes, more regulations, and a more liberal approach to foreign policy.
What are some laws that republicans or democrats have passed that was not popular among their voting base in the same time period?

The Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare, was not popular among Republicans because it expanded Medicaid and gave the federal government greater authority over the healthcare system. The Republican Party blocked the bill at every turn until it became law in 2010, and has since been unsuccessful in repealing it. The Affordable Care Act was signed into law by President Barack Obama in 2010, and was not popular among Republicans because it expanded Medicaid, gave the federal government greater authority over the healthcare system, and increased taxes on the wealthy in order to pay for the law. The Republican Party blocked the bill at every turn until it became law, and has since been unsuccessful in repealing it.
